aia_level_1: The Atmospheric Imaging Assembly (AIA), led from the Lockheed Martin Solar and Astrophysics Laboratory (LMSAL), provides continuous full-disk observations of the solar chromosphere and corona in seven extreme ultraviolet (EUV) channels, spanning a temperature range from approximately 20,000 Kelvin to in excess of 20 million Kelvin
aia_level_1.5: The Atmospheric Imaging Assembly (AIA), led from the Lockheed Martin Solar and Astrophysics Laboratory (LMSAL), provides continuous full-disk observations of the solar chromosphere and corona in seven extreme ultraviolet (EUV) channels, spanning a temperature range from approximately 20,000 Kelvin to in excess of 20 million Kelvin
aia_level_2: The Atmospheric Imaging Assembly (AIA), led from the Lockheed Martin Solar and Astrophysics Laboratory (LMSAL), provides continuous full-disk observations of the solar chromosphere and corona in seven extreme ultraviolet (EUV) channels, spanning a temperature range from approximately 20,000 Kelvin to in excess of 20 million Kelvin
chrotel_level_1: Chromospheric Telescope at the Observatorio del Teide on Tenerife
eit_level_0: The Extreme ultraviolet Imaging Telescope (EIT) is an instrument on the SOHO spacecraft used to obtain high-resolution images of the solar corona in the ultraviolet range

hmi_magnetogram: The Helioseismic and Magnetic Imager (HMI), led from Stanford University in Stanford, California, take high-resolution measurements of the longitudinal and vector magnetic field over the entire visible solar disk
hmi_magnetogram_level_1.5: The Helioseismic and Magnetic Imager (HMI), led from Stanford University in Stanford, California, take high-resolution measurements of the longitudinal and vector magnetic field over the entire visible solar disk
ibis: The Interferometric Bidimensional Spectrometer (IBIS, Cavallini 2006) is a post-focus instrument for solar bi-dimensional spectro-polarimetry
lars_level_1: The Laser Absolute Reference Spectrograph is a high-resolution echelle spectrograph capable of providing absolutely calibrated solar spectra in the visible 480nm to 750nm range
lyra_level_2: LYRA (Large Yield RAdiometer) is a middle-to-extreme ultraviolet radiometer that observes the Sun in four broad passbands, chosen for their relevance to solar physics, aeronomy and space weather
lyra_level_3: LYRA (Large Yield RAdiometer) is a middle-to-extreme ultraviolet radiometer that observes the Sun in four broad passbands, chosen for their relevance to solar physics, aeronomy and space weather
rosa: ROSA is a high cadence, high efficiency solar imager which is installed as a common-user instrument on the Dunn Solar Telescope at the National Solar Observatory in New Mexico, USA
